entry.title: Daily Entry
entry.temperatureHelp: Take your temperature every morning upon waking, BEFORE getting up. Always use the same method (oral, rectal, vaginal).
entry.excludedHelp: Check if the reading is unusual (fever, alcohol, restless night). It won't be used in calculations.
entry.mucusHelp: Observe the sensation and appearance at the vaginal opening. Record the best quality of the day.

mucusDescriptions.ø: Nothing noticeable, neither dry nor wet
mucusDescriptions.S: Visible mucus, stretchy, like raw egg white
mucusDescriptions.S+: Very stretchy, transparent, highly elastic mucus

entry.bleedingHelp: Day 1 of cycle = first day of normal bleeding. Spotting doesn't count as day 1.

bleedingDescriptions.spotting: Light traces, pink or brown spots

entry.symptomsHelp: This information is for your reference, it doesn't affect fertility calculation.

cycle.newConfirm: Confirm start of a new cycle?
cycle.newHint: Day 1 should be the first day of normal bleeding (not spotting)

rules.fiveDay: The first 5 cycle days are considered infertile (if regular cycles of at least 26 days)
rules.minus8: Fertility starts = earliest cycle day with high temperature observed - 8 days
rules.minus20: Fertility starts = shortest cycle length - 20 days
rules.tempShift: 3 consecutive temperatures above the cover line confirm ovulation
rules.mucusPeak: The mucus peak (last high quality observation) marks ovulation
rules.doubleCheck: Post-ovulatory infertility begins when BOTH temperature AND mucus confirm (whichever comes last)
rules.exception1: Exception: 4th temperature needed if the 3rd isn't high enough
rules.exception2: Exception: disturbed temperature = 4 high temperatures required

status.noDataYet: Enter your observations to get your fertility status

settings.title: Settings
settings.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete all data? This action cannot be undone.

warnings.amenorrhea: No period for more than 90 days - consultation recommended
warnings.peakReturned: Return to high mucus quality - count restarted
